result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- No Contact with the victim, residence, school and family(s) without prior court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.
- Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 to the sex offender registry with DOC.

Per Remittitur Dated June 16, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP001345-CR, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in an opinion filed on January 14, 2020, that: 
Judgment and Order affirmed.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 2 Returned from Court of Appeals given to exhibit manager.
Per order dated June 16, 2020, Appeal Nos. 2018AP1345-CR, IT IS ORDERD that the petition for review is denied, without costs.  PATIENCE DRAKE ROGGENSACK, C.J., did not participate.
Acknowledgment of receipt of the Petition for Review, Appeal No. 2018AP001345 CR.

Per order dated February 6, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP1345-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied.  The 30-day period which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged.  First Wisconsin National Bank of Madison v. Nicholaou, 87 Wis. 2d 360, 274 N.W.2d 704 (1979);  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review.  However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. Rules 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed witht the clerk of this court by March 9, 2020.  If a statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.  No further time extensions will be granted.
Per order dated January 14, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP1345-CR, By the Court.-----Judgment and order affirmed.  This opinion will not be published.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.23(1)(b)5.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.

Statements made as to sentencing. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 40 YEARS, with credit for 66 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim, residence, school and family(s) without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.  Bail to be applied.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa and Brenda Bartholomew.

P.M.
At the hour of 3:29pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa, Brenda Bartholomew and Dawn Maldonado.

Jury in box.
Trial resumed.
Sworn for defense: Rosario V. on direct examination.  Cross examination.

Jury out of box.
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.
Parties viewed the closing instructions.

Jury in box.
Defense rest.  Testimony closed.  
Exhibits 5-9 is offered into evidence by defense and received by the courts.
Closing instructions on the law.
Closing arguments by state and defense.  State's rebuttal arguments.

Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:52pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy Mark Spottek and Todd Rosenstein who was duly sworn for that purpose.  
Jury out of box.
Sidebars placed on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.    Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa, Brenda Bartholomew and Dawn Maldonado.
 
A.M.
Jury in box.
Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  S.V. on direct examination.  Cross-examination.  Redirect.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.
Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.

Jury in box.
Sworn for defense: Juan G. Guerrero (therapist) on direct examination.  Cross examination.  Sworn for defense: Andriana M. on direct examination.  Cross examination.  Redirect examination.  Jury out of box.  Defense objects to comments of the court of streamling the testimony and also places reasons on the record for a mistrial.  Court has not found legitimate reasons for a mistrial.  Trial to resume at 1:25pm.

Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.   Previously sworn as interpreters:  Enrique Barbosa and Brenda Bartholomew.

P.M.
Parties discussed the issues with translating the forensic video as it is played in open court.

Hearing held as to State's expert witness.
Sworn for the State:  Amanda Didier (forensic interview specialist) on direct examination.  Cross-examination.  Redirect examination.  Exhibit 1 marked.  Court makes ruling the expert is qualified as a forensic interviewer of children and render an opinion as to delayed disclosure,  peacemeal disclosure and grooming techniques.

Jury in box.
Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Amanda Didier (forensic interview specialist) on direct examination.   Exhibit 1 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts.  Forensic video played in open court.  State continues direct examination of their expert witness.  State marks and offers exhibit 2 into evidence.  Exhibit 2 is received by the courts.  Sidebar.  Exhibits 3 & 4 offered into evidence by State and received by the courts. Jury out of box.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Court took a brief break.

Jury in box.
Testimony continues with cross examination of State's witness.  Redirect examination.  Recross examination.  Sidebar.  Jury out of box.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Trial to resume 11/25/2015 at 9:00am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa, Alexandra Wirth and Brenda Bartholomew.

A.M.
Jury in box.  Trial resumed with opening statements by ADA Kevin Shomin, followed by defense counsel Roberto Ledesma.

Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Noemi R. (with interpreter) on direct examination.  Sidebar.   Jury out of box.

Hearing as to Excited Utterance proceeded:   State examined the witness.  Court heard arguments.  Court rules it as an Excited Utterance.  Defense request to question the witness.  Court now sustains the defense objection to the courts previous ruling as the Excited Utterance.

Jury in box.
Testimony continues with Noemi R. on direct examination.  Sidebar.  Cross-examination.  Sidebar.  Court to hear arguments from defense as to relevance of his objection, out of presence of the jury.  Sidebar.  Re-direct examination.  Sidebar.  Re-cross examination.   Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Court recessed for lunch.  Trial to resume at 1:30pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa and Brenda Bartholomew.

Jury panel in court, previously sworn.
Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:11PM.  Jury out of box.  Strike for cause done on the record out of presence of the jury.  

Jury in box.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box.  Court took a brief break.

Jury in box.
Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  
Court instructed the jury on Opening Instructions on the law.  Jury out of box.  Trial to resume 11/24/2015 at 9:45am.
Opening statements by state and defense.  
Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  *** on direct examination.   Exhibits * offered into evidence by State/defense and received by the courts.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right/agreed to testify.
Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: *on direct examination.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: *.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  
Closing instructions on the law.
Closing arguments by state and defense.  State's rebuttal arguments.
Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of *** to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputy *** who was duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of *** the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY/GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's/Defense motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense/State's motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction/acquittal.  Jury trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Jury panel in court and sworn at 11:45am.   Court recessed for lunch.  Trial to resume at 1:30pm.

Defendant Hector M Martin-Andrade in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.  

Parties discussed any issues.  Court addressed defense request for an adjournment.  Potential Daubert hearing.  Court does not grants defense motion for adjournment.  Depending on ruling, court will include in the jury instructions.  Jury trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
